    • formatDate

      public static java.lang.String formatDate​(long milliseconds)
      Formats milliseconds to a Http Date. (DateTimeFormatter.RFC_1123_DATE_TIME)
      Parameters:
      milliseconds - the time witch should be formatted
      Returns:
      the formatted date

    • formatDate

      Formats a OffsetDateTime to a Http Date. (DateTimeFormatter.RFC_1123_DATE_TIME)
      Parameters:
      dateTime - the OffsetDateTime witch should be formatted
      Returns:
      the formatted date

    • fileExist

      public static boolean fileExist​(java.io.File baseDir, java.io.File file)
      Checks if a file is accessible or exists.
      Parameters:
      baseDir - the Directory, represent as a File, were the file should be located
      file - the File witch should be checked
      Returns:
      if the file is accessible or exists

    • sendFile

      public static void sendFile​(io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerContext ctx, io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request, java.io.File file, boolean body) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes a File to a ChannelHandlerContext.
      Parameters:
      ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext to which the message should be send
      request - the request from the ChannelHandlerContext (Client)
      file - the File which should be send to the ChannelHandlerContext (Client)
      body - if the body should also be send This is needed at HttpMethod.HEAD.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the file

    • setDateHeader

      public static void setDateHeader​(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponse response)
      Adds the HTTP Date header to a HttpResponse. The date is formatted in the DateTimeFormatter.RFC_1123_DATE_TIME format.
      Parameters:
      response - the HttpResponse to which the date header should be added

    • setDateAndCacheHeaders

      public static void setDateAndCacheHeaders​(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponse response, java.io.File fileToCache)
      Adds the HTTP Date and all required Cache headers (Expires, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) to a HttpResponse. The date is formatted in the DateTimeFormatter.RFC_1123_DATE_TIME format.
      Parameters:
      response - the HttpResponse to which the date and cache headers should be added
      fileToCache - the File from from which the cache data should be extracted

    • setContentTypeHeader

      public static void setContentTypeHeader​(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpMessage message, java.io.File file)
      Adds the HTTP Content-Type header to a HttpMessage.
      Parameters:
      message - the HttpMessage to which the content type header should be added
      file - the file from were the content type should be extracted

    • setContentTypeHeader

      public static void setContentTypeHeader​(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpMessage message, java.lang.CharSequence contentType)
      Adds the HTTP Content-Type header to a HttpMessage.
      Parameters:
      message - the HttpMessage to which the content type header should be added
      contentType - the content type as a CharSequence which should be used

    • setContentTypeHeader

      public static void setContentTypeHeader​(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpMessage message, java.lang.CharSequence contentType, java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
      Adds the HTTP Content-Type header to a HttpMessage.
      Parameters:
      message - the HttpMessage to which the content type header should be added
      contentType - the content type as a CharSequence which should be used
      charset - the Charset of the content type

    • checkModified

      public static boolean checkModified​(java.time.Instant instant, java.io.File file)
      Checks if the File has been edited since the specified Instant.
      Parameters:
      instant - the Instant with which it should be checked if the File has been edited
      file - the File which should be checked
      Returns:
      if the File has been edited since the specified Instant

    • sendRedirect

      public static void sendRedirect​(io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerContext ctx, io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request, java.net.URI newUri)
      Sends a redirect ot the new uri to the specified ChannelHandlerContext.
      Parameters:
      ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext to which the redirect should be send
      request - the HttpRequest from the ChannelHandlerContext
      newUri - the new URI to witch the client should be redirected

    • sendNotModified

      public static void sendNotModified​(io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerContext ctx, io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request)
      Sends to the ChannelHandlerContext thad the requested content is not modified science the last.
      Parameters:
      ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext to which the redirect should be send
      request - the HttpRequest from the ChannelHandlerContext

    • sendStatus

      public static void sendStatus​(io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerContext ctx, io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request, io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status)
      Send a status to a ChannelHandlerContext (Client).
      Parameters:
      ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext to which the message should be send
      request - the request from the ChannelHandlerContext (Client)
      status - the status which should be send to the ChannelHandlerContext (Client)

    • sendStatus

      public static void sendStatus​(io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerContext ctx, io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest request, io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status, boolean body)
      Send a status to a ChannelHandlerContext (Client).
      Parameters:
      ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext to which the message should be send
      request - the request from the ChannelHandlerContext (Client)
      status - the status which should be send to the ChannelHandlerContext (Client)
      body - if the status code should be send also via the LastHttpContent (Http Body)

    • sendAndCleanupConnection

      public static void sendAndCleanupConnection​(io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerContext ctx, io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponse response, io.netty.handler.codec.http.LastHttpContent content)
      Sends a response to a ChannelHandlerContext (Client).
      Parameters:
      ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext to which the message should be send
      response - the response which should be send to the ChannelHandlerContext (Client)
      content - the content which should be send to the ChannelHandlerContext (Client)
